comment._content: More like time to shoot the morons making fatuous remarks tagging these photos.  Maybe they don't have enough intelligence to realize what they're looking at!

comment._content: I agree. It's like spraying graffiti on a tomb stone. The disrespect and ignorance is completely beyond me.

comment._content: Cannot believe the photo quality in these conditions - tripods and plates, after all, not pocket-digi cams.

comment._content: Thats a big scratch....bite on this while I cut your limb off, technology was wonderful back then, lol.

comment.author: 21417004@N08
comment._content: That guys arm is totally necrotic.  He has been carrying that injury around for a long time.  The doctors probably just changed the dressing every couple of days and sent him on his way.  Poor guy.

comment.author: 28079146@N07
comment._content: a picture truly is worth a thousand words. their faces tell us what horrors these young men have experienced and the conditions in which the medics had to try to save lives.

comment._content: Perhaps the irony is british wounded soldiers being attended to in a captured german dugout

comment.author: 7925034@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/worldviewwonder] I made that comment as it was their outdated tactics used by their generals that got so many killed. Asking them to run straight into machigun nests, artillary barrages, and what ever else was waiting for them. Thus my comment. Looking at the wounded men in the picture, my reaction to it was they needed to shoot their general. Not that I need to explain my comment to you or anyone else. Moron.
